alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Little River, northwestern Hempstead, northwestern Miller, southern Sevier, southeastern Howard, southern McCurtain, northern Bowie and central Red River Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 530 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Boxelder to near Foreman to near Mandeville. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, De Queen, Ashdown, Nashville, Clarksville, Mineral Springs, Horatio, Foreman, Boxelder, Idabel, De Kalb, Red Lick, Lockesburg, Wilton, Tollette, Fulton, Winthrop, Ogden, Ben Lomond and Arkinda. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
